    • Method Detail

      • register

        public void register(@Nonnull
                     String prefix,
                     @Nonnull
                     XPropsConverter.Conversion<?,?> factory)
              throws XPropsConverter.DuplicateConversionException
        Registers a new alias mapping for converting property values to typed objects using the given prefix and factory.

        The type prefix represents a Java or JDK type as listed here:

        Prefix Type
        address java.net.InetSocketAddress
        bundle java.util.ResourceBundle
        byte java.lang.Byte
        class java.lang.Class
        date java.time.LocalDate
        decimal java.math .BigDecimal
        double java.lang.Double
        duration java.time.Duration
        file java.io.File
        float java.lang.Float
        inet java.net.InetAddress
        int java.lang.Integer
        integer java.math.BigInteger
        long java.lang.Long
        path java.nio.file.Path
        period java.time.Period
        resource
        regex java.util.regex.Pattern
        org.springframework.core.io.Resource
        resource* java.util.List&lt;org.springframework.core.io.Resource&gt;
        short java.lang.Short
        time java.time.LocalDateTime
        timestamp java.time.Instant
        tz java.util.TimeZone
        uri java.net.URI
        url java.net.URL
        Parameters:
        prefix - the alias prefix, never missing
        factory - the factory, never missing
        Throws:
        XPropsConverter.DuplicateConversionException - if prefix is already registered

        public <T> T convert(@Nonnull

              throws Exception
        Throws:
